enWisdom: Foolishness makes one a stranger in his own hometown

Wisdom: الْأَحْمَقُ غَرِيبٌ فِي بَلْدَتِهِ مُهَانٌ بَيْنَ أَعِزَّتِهِ
enWisdom: The fool is a stranger in his [own] hometown, [and is] humiliated among his near ones
With foolishness, what is sought is not achieved
Beware of dimwittedness for verily it causes one to be deserted by his friends

Wisdom: دَعِ السَّفَهَ فَإِنَّهُ يُزْرِي بِالْمَرْءِ وَيَشِينُهُ
enWisdom: Shun dimwittedness, for verily it belittles a person and dishonor’s him
Dimwittedness is enough as a disgrace

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ السَّفَهِ تُوجِبُ الشَّنَئَانَ وَتَجْلِبُ الْبَغْضَاءَ
enWisdom: Increased dimwittedness brings about ill feelings and gives rise to hatred
One whose obscenity increases is regarded as vile
